abstract.text: Sets the title to use for the specified state.

inlineContent.text: The title to use for the specified state.
The state that uses the specified title.

Use this method to set the title for the button. The title you specify derives its formatting from the button’s associated label object. If you set both a title and an attributed title for the button, the button prefers the use of the attributed title over this one.
At a minimum, set the value for the
state. If you don’t specify a title for the other states, the button uses the title associated with the
state. If you don’t set the value for
, then the property defaults to a system value.
When the user interface idiom is
, your app throws an exception if you use this method to set the title for any state other than

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A style that indicates that a control appears and behaves as it does in macOS.
A control that executes your custom code in response to user interactions.
Returns the styled title associated with the specified state.
The style that determines how the button behaves.
Sets the styled title to use for the specified state.
Sets the title to use for the specified state.
Sets the color of the title to use for the specified state.
Sets the color of the title shadow to use for the specified state.
Returns the title associated with the specified state.
Returns the title color used for a state.
A view that displays the value of the
property for a button.
Returns the shadow color of the title used for a state.
The base class for controls, which are visual elements that convey a specific action or intention in response to user interactions.
Constants describing the state of a control.
The normal, or default, state of a control where the control is enabled but neither selected nor highlighted.
An interface designed for the Mac.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.

value.text: A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
